problems.title: GCD of Two Numbers (Recursive)
problems.description:
Given two non-negative integers A and B, compute their greatest common divisor (GCD) using recursion (Euclidean algorithm).

Input Format:
Two integers A and B separated by space.

Output Format:
Print a single integer representing gcd(A, B).
problems.examples:
Sample Input
24 18

Sample Output
6

Sample Input
7 5

Sample Output
1
problems.constraints: 0 <= A, B <= 10^9 (at least one of them > 0)
hintsList: Use Euclid's algorithm: gcd(a, b) = gcd(b, a % b), with base when b == 0.
